tricks.description:
By locking onto an enemy or scan point and strafing left or right, then pressing R immediately after strafing, Samus' momentum can be maintainted. This is useful in crossing gaps.
Check the wiki for more details.

By chaining multiple bombs, you can reach heights you wouldn't otherwise. Higher difficulties of this trick can involve horizontal movement, unmorphing in air, extremely precise bomb placements and timing.
Check the wiki for more details.

Jumping against a slope grants extra height when jumping, allowing access to ledges that are out of reach.
Check the wiki for more details.

A broad category for non-obvious movement which can't easily be classified using other tricks. Some of these include: precise jumps, long suitless runs through Ingclaw and Ingstorm, using Screw Attack for a slight height boost, among others.

Bomb Jumping and unmorphing backwards to a wall or forwards from an overhang to get an instant unmorph, then jumping within 2/5 of a second after leaving the ground gives a height boost to reach higher ledges.
Check the wiki for more details.

Rolling off a ledge, getting an instant unmorph, and jumping within 2/5 of a second after unmorphing grants speed and horizontal distance. This is useful in crossing gaps such as Watch Station Access.
Check the wiki for more details.

Pressing L and R at the same time while moving underwater locks Samus' speed, allowing access to areas early, such as Hydrodynamo Station terminals without going around.
Check the wiki for more details.

Morphing at the same frame the camera enters the water produces a weird visual effect. This allows Screw Attack to be used underwater.
Check the wiki for more details.

Traveling outside the room boundaries to gain access to areas/rooms otherwise unreachable given the circumstances. Currently only used for single-room traversal.
Check the wiki for more details.
This trick covers traversal through Ingclaw and Ingstorm without having Dark Suit or Light Suit. Energy Tanks are used as a replacement.

Using Screw Attack without Space Jump does not work as intended unless the Screw Attack is intiated specific rooms where Samus's position in the Z-Axis is 0. The main usage of this trick is in upper Sanctuary Fortress.
Check the wiki for more details.
Boosting at the right time when making contact with a wall allows Samus to launch upwards a bit. Typically used in Morph Ball tunnels.
Some enemies can be jumped off of which gives a height boost and access to areas that are just out of reach with a normal jump.
Mainly used for bosses, requiring either less items or less health to beat a boss.

Morphing near a wall or a ceiling can cause Samus to be morphed without the animation, allowing access to Morph Ball tunnels from the back, or entering a tunnel unintended.
Check the wiki for more details.

Objects that normally need visors to be seen or accessed without the required visor, such as Dark Visor platforms or Quadraxis without Echo Visor, can be possible in logic depending on the difficulty.
Some parts of the terrain can be abused and stood on, allowing access to certain areas otherwise unreachable.
Some terminal fall triggers can be used to warp to certain sections of a room, such as Watch Station Access or Grand Windchamber.

Similar to a Roll Jump, except it does not require a ledge, and it requires Boost Ball. By morphing and barely tapping left or right on the stick, the camera desyncs from Samus. By boosting and jumping within the 2/5 of a second window, great distances can be covered.
Check the wiki for more details.

A strafe dash that is interrupted by holding left or right mid-jump, then pressing R and jumping within a short frame window of touching the ground, gives a lot of speed. This is useful in crossing large gaps.
Check the wiki for more details.
By shooting Darkburst, Sunburst, or Sonic Boom and morphing at the right time, some Bomb Slots can be activated, skipping the Bombs requirement. Sunburst is not usable on most slots however.
Some gates can be opened from reverse either with Scan Visor or a Beam Combo. Some examples include Industrial Site or Hive Dynamo Access.
Screw Attack is Morph Ball sized, so it can be used to enter tunnels and Morph Ball-sized openings. Be careful not to jump once inside the tunnel, as you can easily clip out of bounds if you do.

This trick covers knowing the vulnerabilities of objects beyond their intended uses. Some examples include Super Missiles to break Transport A Access rubble, Light Crystals with Screw Attack or Trooper Secuirty Station Power Bomb gates with Screw Attack.
With a well-placed Screw Attack and a Missile or two, it is possible to open Seeker Missile doors without the Seeker Launcher.
